Docs.summary: Specifies how visual styles are applied to the current application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.VisualStyleState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to specify whether visual styles are applied to client or nonclient areas of application windows.
## Examples The following code example is a simple program that applies visual styles in each of the four areas specified by the VisualStyleState values. To enable visual styles in a certain area, click the option button (also known as a radio button) that represents the area you want to enable, and click the **Update VisualStyleState** button to observe the changes in the window.
